title: Nifty: Amid ‘Dilemma Of Trade Deals’ Looks Ready For A Meltdown
text:
On analysis of the movements of , in different time frames, since the stimulatory announcements by the India’s Finance Minister Mrs. Nirmala Sitharaman on September 19th, 2019 on corporate tax cut, followed by one more boosting dose on September 23rd, 2019 with inspiring news on ‘Modi-Trump Trade Deal’ up to end of September, 2019; fueled bullish sentiments in Indian equity markets which resulted in a bumpy move of Nifty 50 up to the level of 11,695 on September 23rd, 2019. But, slowly the news flow on this expected Modi-Trump Trade Deal looks to be faded shortly in the absence of any further news flow on developments on this . Nifty 50 started to witness exhaustive moves, soon after the formation of an “Exhaustive Candle” in the weekly time frame.

On the other hand, Sino-U.S. tariff trade deal also looks to be amid dilemma too, after the on resolving this issue before the October 10th – 11th , 2019 meeting between the U.S. and the China; which has resulted in growing slowdown fear, causing extended bearishness in U.S. equity indices and well in other Asian equity markets. No doubt that the growing hopes on final resolution over the Sino-U.S. tariff trade war resulted in some downward move in , but once again Gold looks ready to bounce once again; which enhances the probabilities of the growing fear of economic slowdown.

Finally, I conclude that if the starts the trading session on October 9th, 2019 with a gap-down, and remains below the level of 11,100; it may trigger a heavy sell-off during the upcoming trading sessions. No doubt, if Nifty 50 remains unable to defend its immediate support at 10,946; a steep downward move may be the next possibility.
